website_summaries.verdict: Wide and deep stairs work well for pets with short legs. Three designs offer different height options.
pros: Able to machine wash cover on steps that's easy to remove
Pet owners say soft steps provide traction for animals that slip on other types of steps
cons: Some reports of difficulty assembling the steps
Carpeted cover slides a bit, which some pets don't like

customer_reviews.title: Bag of Cardboard!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of junk. Manufacturer is perpetrating an outright bait-and-switch. This is supposed to be a deluxe model of their plastic Easy Step. It marketed as a soft covered hard plastic structure. What I received was filled with cardboard. A cloth bag of cardboard for $64.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its great !
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my pet to get in the window and he loves it !
customer_reviews.author: kls

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING FITS!!!  Don't waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: First of all I want to say this is the 3rd set of these steps I've ordered in the last 5 years so I thought I knew what I was getting. I just needed a taller set. Well, first of all the directions do not match the item I got...fun!!! It took a hammer and drill to finally get it together because I am disabled and no way I could carry this to return it plus I really need it!!! Nothing matches. One hole wasn't even all the way through...that's where the drill came in. The cloth cover doesn't even fit!!! I just spent nearly $100 for 5 dollars worth of plastic :( I'm not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Patty D

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a staircase for my 60lb dog as I have a very high bed. It assembled very easily. But when I went to put the cover over on, it was obviously used!! The odor from the cover was overwhelming. It smelled as though a cat had sprayed it. The item was too bulky to easily return it, so I repeatedly washed the cover. Now there is no smell. The product itself is good and works well enough. My dog took to it quickly. But was very disappointed that I received a used product.
customer_reviews.author: Kaceey

customer_reviews.title: Nice and tall
customer_reviews.text: We have a super tall (36”) bed with four columns and it was difficult to locate stairs tall enough to reach the top if the bed. A 5lb yorkie doesn’t need to leap up from or down to stairs (which would defeat the purpose) and most stairs were 27” max.. These are great. Stair depth is not too small. It suits our needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Not the best in the world.
customer_reviews.text: These slide across hardwood floors very easily...even with a 5 pound chihuahua using them. You will definitely need to use other measures to secure these steps. I imagine they'll slip and slide on carpet as well because of the material and light weight of these steps. I thought they would have weighed more or at least have been developed to have rubber stoppers to prevent sliding. Please be careful because your pet will likely fall if you do not secure these steps. I have these put away in a closet and don't want them, so if anyone wants mine I'll gladly give them to you for free or just the cost for shipping. westkv at appstate dot edu.
customer_reviews.author: katherine gaddy

customer_reviews.title: I bought this step for my 12 year old beagle ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this step for my 12 year old beagle. It took her about 3 days before she took to it. Now she steps up at night, but still jumps off in the morning. She will not go down. but that's ok. She is still healthy and strong. Every little thing helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These steps for a large dog are exactly what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research trying to find heavy-duty steps for my 85 pound English Pointer dog for my very high platform bed. Assembly was easy and the steps look nice. My dog used the steps the first try, with the help of a dog treat placed on the top step. I highly recommend these steps.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: $100 for a $30 Item - Cheap all the way Through
customer_reviews.text: I needed high steps for my shitzu to get on and off the bed. This was one of the few I could find. Assembly was pretty easy. Its cheap plastic with no padding on the steps. They provide like a throw cover that goes over the stairs and it is not tight AT ALL. My dog slips on each step and has fallen back down a couple of times. She's afraid of using these. For me, this was a near-total waste of money if not total. And they charge premium for a very cheaply made item. My suggestion is to find something else
customer_reviews.author: Cajuknight

customer_reviews.title: Don't be misled by any negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that these pet stairs are just the thing for our aging cat to navigate down from our bed to the floor. That being said, after ordering them and then reading the negative reviews, I was frantically trying to cancel the order and replace them with something else before I had fairly assessed them myself. However, the ease of assembly, the lightweight maneuverability and sturdiness are huge selling points - in addition to the reasonable pricing. I'm only too happy that I wasn't allowed cancellation of this product. Cat endorsed too!
customer_reviews.author: lp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my senior dog and I had others but he wouldn't use them. He uses these just fine. I was happy that I was able to purchased used from Amazon because I only needed them for the senior dog and unfortunately he probably will not be around much longer. This way I don't spend a lot on something I won't be using a long time. They were in perfect condition and came in original box with instructions and everything.
customer_reviews.author: stpetesunset

customer_reviews.title: My dog is scared to use it once the slip cover slipped out from under him
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I didn’t realize this was just a few hard plastic pieces that you snap together and then slip a slip-cover over. I thought it was one solid stuffed piece — like the other stuffed pet stairs that are sold. So that’s my fault for not researching better. The pieces don’t snap together very solidly, so they slide a little and then the slip cover doesn’t attach, it just slips over and zips around it, so it’s loose and not very taunt against the steps. So because of that, my dog (a short dachshund) is scared to use it now, because the pieces don’t stay sturdy and the slip cover slips under him when he’s jumping up it.
customer_reviews.author: Faye Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stairs with great cover and easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: These stairs were exactly the type that i was looking for. Great lightweight, yet sturdy with a durable washable cover that did not allow for exposed plastic. I was skeptical when I saw a photo that showed the inside was cardboard (because spills happen) but clearly that is NOT what is inside. These stairs are quality. I did have to return them because once i assembled them they were several inches too big (because i cant measure lol) and my 6lb chihuahua who is now 13 couldn't quite get over the top part. The company was great with the return and I hope to find a better fitting set of stairs with them to order.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie K

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. For one thing the height is supposed to be 30.5 inches which is exactly what my bed measured, but when I put them side by side, the steps were at least 4 inches taller than the bed. The padding was very loose and had a strong chemical smell to it. The item was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Williams

customer_reviews.title: Money thrown away
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly constructed. On day two three plastic pegs cracked on different parts and it fell apart. Certainly not able to handle up to 75 lbs as my dog is 45 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Walter D. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Works in either orientation - can be tall or can be not-so-tall.
customer_reviews.text: Aging cat needed this leg up to get onto our bed, which was high. It seemed to me this would work in either orientation, and it did. While pictured as a long stair with short that rise a certain amount, that wouldn't have been enough for our bed, and it worked standing on end, as a short stair with tall steps. So consider height and length to be interchangeable! Covering is easily removed for washing, but with an indoor animal, we haven't done that yet - just the occasional vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Redmann

customer_reviews.title: These steps are perfect for my older cat that cannot jump up on ...
customer_reviews.text: These steps are perfect for my older cat that cannot jump up on the bed anymore. He can easily and comfortably go up and down them. They are almost as tall as the bed and my bed is a little taller than most. It took awhile for him to go down them but after a few times of me putting him on the top step and encouraging him to go down, he started going down on his own.
customer_reviews.author: P Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good For Small-Medium Dogs, Not 150-lb Dogs
customer_reviews.text: While I must say I like the product's quality, etc, I feel I should warn others about why I am returning mine. Even though the description says for "up to 150-lbs" my 45-lb Shepherd mix can not use it due to her body being too long for the steps. On the outside of the package, it does show that is for Small or Medium dogs, not Large dogs, and I would say that is the case. So, ignore the weight limit in the description, and keep in mind that this is for smaller dogs. Again though, the product was good in my opinion, so if your dog has a smaller frame, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jademan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my senior cat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 17 year old baby kitty can't always clear the jump onto my bed. I know it hurts her to pull herself up, and it was tearing my comforter to shreds, so I bought this. I trained her to use it by putting treats on the steps so that she got used to walking up them. It took her two or three days but she now uses them exclusively. This is great and I'd recommend to anyone-we're probably going to buy another for the couch!
customer_reviews.author: Tchaikoffee

customer_reviews.title: Size of pet and step width
customer_reviews.text: My pet loves using the smaller two step Pet Gear Step II. She is a small/med size beagle with a torn ACL. She panics using the step iv because the step widths are smaller and the cover doesn't help her mental state. The steps are not wide enough for her to take her time with. So we are going to get a Pet Gear Bed Stairs that wraps around the bed, and has wider platforms for her to get up and down off of the higher bed versus a simple couch.
customer_reviews.author: Randman

customer_reviews.title: recommend
customer_reviews.text: we bought this for my mothers 6 year old Maltese. She was too much of a chicken to use it to get on bed so we set it up for our 15 year old dachshund to get up on the couch. It works great for him. he took to it right away. we have a similar one for the bed but it is not completely covered in sheepskin material and we have to cover with a towel. would highly recommend the completely covered one because they slip on any exposed plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Jones

customer_reviews.title: it is tall enough
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is easy to put together. It also is tall enough for my tall bed. Big problem is the cover is so loose that my Peanut slides right off, now is afraid to get back on. Another person suggested getting velcro to hold the material to the steps, I will try that since I threw the shipping box away, otherwise I probably would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great except...
customer_reviews.text: The cover smells like menstrual discharge. I have washed it twice, let it set in the sun, soaked it, then washed it again, and it still has a faint smell. This is not a joke, and the smell is not funny at all. Other than, it is sturdy and works well. I would give 5 stars if not for that smell.
customer_reviews.author: Richard White

customer_reviews.title: These Stairs Are Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These stairs are awesome. I had previously purchased plastic stairs for my Dachshund mix dog from PetSmart and he had a really hard time getting up and down; in fact, he was terrified. These stairs are perfect since they have the right width and depth to help him get up and down the bed comfortably. Also, they don't slide everywhere when he's on them, which I think is one big reason why he likes using them.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Brodzky

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crapola!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT waste your money! No tools required, yeah right! It was impossible to put together. And it’s too big to fool with returning it. I can’t even give it away. Always check your pet store first! Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Renee M.

customer_reviews.title: I like how it is lightweight and easy to move and ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for my Yorkie to get up and down from the couch. I like how it is lightweight and easy to move and the steps have wider depth which makes it easier for their step. I placed some foam non slip padding on the steps before I placed the cover over them to add more security from slippage since the steps are a slick plastic underneath the padded cover. Worked wonderfully she took to it very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: arowens

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for older pets that have arthritis.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good item for older dogs to go up and down the steps. It should have wider steps. Also it is deceptive because it seems as though the steps are soft cushioning, but it is hard plastic covered with a cloth topping. My dogs fell twice trying g to get up or down the steps. Not good for older dogs.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good !
customer_reviews.text: If your dog is say 35# or under these will work fine. They seemed a little cheap, but once assembled were actually reasonably sturdy. My 23# pound dog uses them religiously now and loves them....
customer_reviews.author: Stbentoak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tall beds
customer_reviews.text: The stairs are 30.5 inches tall which makes it perfect for my three miniature dachshunds to get on and off my tall bed. The cover for the stairs is soft and prevents slipping. It is easy to clean and vacuum. It also has a zipper so it can be removed to wash if necessary. The stairs are not very heavy and can easily be moved to clean around.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Good for big dogs not small ones
customer_reviews.text: These steps would be great for a larger 30+ lb dog but are not well suited for small ones. I went out on a limb because I have a smaller similar version that goes onto our couches, but three steps are not enough for these tall ones to the bed. The incline between steps are far too high for my chihuahuas and they were scared going up and down and after a few tries decided to just not use them. I had to buy a different brand that had more steps.
customer_reviews.author: James and Michelle Messina

customer_reviews.title: Will not fall apart, you’d have to really abuse it to get it to break down.
customer_reviews.text: Hard plastic stair case was easy to assemble and the cover has a long zipper to put on and remove. You can put the cover in the washing machine without it shrinking and in wrinkle free. I love thisvstair case and my small dogs use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Pet Gear Step Deluxe Soft Step
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to enable my 2 20 lb dogs to get onto the bed, without having to pick them up or take them off the bed.. The steps did not reach the top of the bed, and the dogs were required to jump up to reach the bed. They did not and will not use it. I do not have the box or would have returned it. I would still like to return it. The specifications and details were not apparent at purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together; no tools needed. The steps are big (wide) but also steep so a little hard for my 16 year old Papillion to maneuver so I place these steps along the side of the bed so my dog can use it laterally versus walking up the steps as a normal way people / dogs walk up steps. Very sturdy and durable. Definitely not cheaply made very sturdy. Very good quality for price point.
customer_reviews.author: L. Watanabe

customer_reviews.title: The perfect doggy bed
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st doggy stairs that we have really liked! It is tall enough to reach our bed! It has an easy zipper soft cover that goes over a hard sturdy plastic frame. This part is what I love! We have had soft foam ones, cardboard frame ones and they just get smashed and lose their structure! This one is here for the long run!😊
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Stairs aren't level
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed as the stairs on not level. They are higher in the back and lower in the front. The entire unit is plastic with the material carpeting that zips over it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: The carpet that you put over the stairs tends to ...
customer_reviews.text: The carpet that you put over the stairs tends to slide - my dog would not use this item because of the loose carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This one is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: After trying several dog steps, this one finally worked for my little old Shih Tzu. The wider, softer steps allowed her to get her entire body on each step and she was using it on the first day. She's old and arthritic, so now when she wants to nap, I know exactly where to find her...on the bed! It was easy to assemble and I love that the cover comes off to be washed. Just a side note...the cover smelled almost toxic when I took it out of the package, but after I sprayed it with Febreeze and let it dry, the odor totally disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vargus

customer_reviews.title: My three Cairn Terrier's are really happy. Perfect height for our new bed as they ...
customer_reviews.text: My three Cairn Terrier's are really happy. Very sturdy stairs, and easy to assemble. Perfect height for our new bed as they do not have to jump up any higher than the stairs. No problems with being scared going down the stairs which I thought was going to be an issue/deal breaker. The steps are nice and wide, so they have no trouble. They can now visit with us without me worrying about them hurting themselves jumping off a 30" high bed. I am extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: melinda jones

customer_reviews.title: Steps for your Dog!
customer_reviews.text: So, I would love to give this item 5 stars but the item I received was obviously shipped to someone who returned it and then they sent it to me! The plastic of the steps is all scratched up and the box itself was beat to crap and all the labels had been cut off of it from where someone else had it before me!!! I took pictures but I guess there is no where to upload them....
customer_reviews.author: Mary B. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these stairs
customer_reviews.text: I like the height of the stairs, but I had to have a neighbor put it together for me.. Seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect. They are large and do take up room
customer_reviews.text: We needed TALL stairs for the little old lady. These are perfect. They are large and do take up room, but we put them parallel to the foot board and they are perfect. They are sturdy which is important because the little old lady is not so sturdy anymore. The fabric cover comes off easily. I haven't had to wash it yet, but it looks like it can be washed and probably line dried. Would be nice if there replacement covers available and maybe there is. Haven't checked in to that.
customer_reviews.author: ICthruya

customer_reviews.title: Very well built and easy to move
customer_reviews.text: Oliver is a 19 year old cat that really appreciates to go up to the bed. The steps are a little tall but he manages. i really like it but I ir it without the cover so he won’t fall. Could be a little wider!
customer_reviews.author: Ttobon

customer_reviews.title: These steps were the right height
customer_reviews.text: We have a tall bed and I was looking for steps tall enough so that my two bichons could climp up. The steps were the right height and it only took a couple of days for one of my babies to get the hang of it. The other baby is more stubborn and refuses to use them; however, I am happy with the purchase. Maybe she will figure it out soon!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't easy for me to put together but my sister had it together In less than 10 minutes. As our beds are all around 30 inches tall and our chihuahuas are aging these steps are great. Love the washable cover.
customer_reviews.author: Heather McCurley

customer_reviews.title: There is some snap together assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic base puzzle to put together. I needed a low set of steps and thought these would be similar to the foam steps I have for the bed. Should have read the description more carefully. Returned them.
customer_reviews.author: agypsyfoot2

customer_reviews.title: Great value, nice product
customer_reviews.text: Terrific value . Assembles very easily , and the cover zips on. I am using them for my small dogs to look out a window. Also can be used for getting on a bed.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not that sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend for large dogs. My husky/shepherd mix didn’t have any part of it bc wasn’t sturdy when he walked up so freaked him out. The cover isn’t very thick either and wasn’t fitted well (sagging in some spots). However measurements are accurate and simple to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but my mistake
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and probably works okay for most. When putting it together the dogs were around and it slipped out of my hands and it hit the floor hard making loud noise. Now my dogs will not go anywhere around it, no matter what I entice them with. Will try to find a good home for it. The step, not the dogs. :)
customer_reviews.author: Raymond E. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed
customer_reviews.text: Everything is exactly as I expected. The structure is made of easy to assemble plastic panels with pegs that pop into holes of other pieces. Requires a bit of force to push in but nothing unruly. The finished structure is light but rigid, and being made of plastic, is waterproof. The bottom has four rubber pads that help grip the floor and stop additional sliding. The cloth cover is removable, washable, and easy to reinstall having only one zipper. Highly recommend for any size pet (my 50 pound blue heeler climbs up and down just fine).
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Mora III

customer_reviews.title: Great for aging dogs
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to put together. Although our corgi-chi mix has always lived our two story home, he aWasnt sure of the new stairs. Only had them one day and he's making progress! Ours was not filled with cardboard as the other review stated. More like Little Tykes furniture.
customer_reviews.author: RSMCATHY

customer_reviews.title: Nice and helpful.
customer_reviews.text: I was going to headline this review by saying, nice for the price. However, I don't remember how much I paid for the steps. I have a small Shih-Tzu (well, she's getting bigger) and she can't climb them, but they're helping her with perception and she can go down them. My bed is very high, so that alone is a plus. I think my Gypsy might be getting the hang of it going up, but not quite there, yet. Yes, I'd recommend these steps.
customer_reviews.author: D. MCDONALDTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Well built and sturdy, the stairs even stay in place when the ...
customer_reviews.text: Well built and sturdy, the stairs even stay in place when the crazy one starts going nuts and running up and down them. Strong enough for the 35 pound dachshund, not sure I would feel comfortable with my golden going up them though. The furry cover still looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: APL

customer_reviews.title: Not as stated...
customer_reviews.text: Sent these back. The picture looks like they are foam but it is this weird plastic thing that folds up under the cover. It's not steady. My dogs would have nothing to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: It's sized right and sturdy enough for my 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: It's sized right and sturdy enough for my 9 year old, 7.5 lb chihuahua to use when getting up on and down from our sofa. There's just enough anti skid (rubber?) on the bottom to keep it in place on our wood floors. Although we are teaching the grandchildren not to sit on it - they both have and there wasn't any indication of stress on the plastic whatsoever. My grandson is about 40 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: mamacat

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller dogs. . .
customer_reviews.text: The steps are great for a smaller dog, but would not recommend for a larger dog due to the depth of each step. My dog is 20 lbs and that's about right for this product.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: No replacement cover
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd set of these and they are great until the zipper on the cover breaks or the material wears out. There is no option to replace the cover. You have to purchase a new set of stairs even though those will last forever. Once the current one wears out I am shopping for a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Lori A Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old Cock A Poo can easily go down but has some hesitancy going up
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to construct as the pieces did not slide together well and the directions were somewhat lacking. My 10 year old Cock A Poo can easily go down but has some hesitancy going up , especially getting started as they are somewhat steep. She has arthritis in one knee. I have a tall bed and they were the correct height, so that was a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Terri A. Hannan

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This came up on a search for foam stairs & it calls itself “soft”. It’s heavy plastic with fleece cover. Also, stairs tip downward, freaking my wimpy dog out. Seems pricey for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: T. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Height is just right
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding steps that were as tall as my mattress. The steps are just the right height. My only complaint is that the width of each step is fairly narrow which makes it hard for my dog to go down the steps safely. No problems going up the steps though.
customer_reviews.author: Kymesh

customer_reviews.title: Great item for small to medium sized dogs
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. I have tried other steps where the steps are the same width but not as deep, and my small dogs (Yorkies) did not like to use them. These steps are deep enough for the dogs to feel comfortable climbing them. The "sheepskin" cover gives great traction and the dogs are comfortable going up and down the steps.
customer_reviews.author: Lumberjack

customer_reviews.title: works great for my 8lb chihuahua
customer_reviews.text: Really had to muscle the pieces together, but once I figured that out, assembly was simple. Stairs taper down slightly; works great for my 8lb chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Put it together for one night
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog who was diagnosed with cancer. Unfortunately, it progressed quickly and he never got to use it. We will see if the puppy wants to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat doesn't like this
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and easy to assemble, but my cat wants nothing to do with it. She'd rather continue to try and jump up. Must be a pride thing.......
customer_reviews.author: Boatwhistle

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. The carpeting/covering on the steps is a little loose, so our dog hesitates, need to tighten it up!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Grace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small and long dogs such as daschunds.
customer_reviews.text: Wide steps allow enough room for small dogs, even daschunds, to situate their whole body on every step as they climb the stairs. Each step has a slight incline meaning the stairs can reach further heights with a minimum amount of steps. My 7 inch doxie can easily climb on to the 30 inch bed with these stairs and it doesn't take up as much floor space as some pet stairs can.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Hein

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a nice product, but the smell of it (the cover) was horrific upon opening. It was shorter than expected and my dog refused to use it so I’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Figiel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for couch, and over weight dachshund 😊
customer_reviews.text: My dachshunds have bad backs and can’t jump up on couch anymore. These small steps are just the right size, they Don’t get in my way.
customer_reviews.author: Elise J.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The pieces clicked firmly into place, but the first step still made a noise that scared my dog. Also, the steps look more padded in the picture than they actually are.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A

customer_reviews.title: Great steps
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 year old cat 🐈 is so comfortable going up and down these steps. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Nan Mel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy plastic with a smooth cover that stays in place
customer_reviews.text: High enough for my cat and little dog to see out the window - most aren't tall enough. Sturdy plastic with a smooth cover that stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Stone

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent staircase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my old dog to get up on the bed and has worked great. Took a bit to teach her how to use it, but she finally got it. No more waking me up at night trying to get back onto the bed. Easy to put together and has a lambs wool cover for the steps that can be removed for washing. Totally worth the money.
